comment.body:
> we don't have any obvious disclaimer in documentation for oqs-provider 

Added with latest commit. Feedback solicited as to whether there's more component disclaimers we'd like/should list.

issue.title: Fix OQS_ADDL_SOCKET_LIBS setting for cmake
issue.body:
This fixes the cmake flag so it generates the right lib dependencies for msvc build. Otherwise, ths VS would complain about:
**LINK : fatal error LNK1104: cannot open file 'ws2_32.lib gdi32.lib crypt32.lib'**

comment.body:
> > The workflow defined in windows.yml only covers cygwin and msvc(ninja), I was trying to build with Visual Studio 2019.
> 
> Understood. What about adding a CI job for this then as part of this PR, too? This way we can be sure this never happens again.

I tried to add a CI job but encountered a several problems:

Issues 1:

If liboqs is built with Windows 2019 (shipped only with latest Visual Studio version 16), it would failed and the CI raw output as below:

```
2023-09-20T08:39:29.6802712Z   Generating Code...
2023-09-20T08:39:29.9024228Z Done Building Project "D:\a\oqs-provider\oqs-provider\liboqs\build\src\common\common.vcxproj" (default targets) -- FAILED.
```

Issues 2:

Change to Visual Studio version 16/MSVC 19 solved the first issue. The liboqs pass the build but if I run the follow test code:

```
cmake --build build --target run_tests
```
All the tests failed. But I also solved the issue 2.

Issue 3:

When CI run tests for oqs-provider, CTest reports no tests found without -C on multi-config generators. 

Original command

```
ctest -V --test-dir _build
```

As [cmake issue](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/issues/20283) point out, we need to add args "-C Debug" or "-C Release" accordingly in the build tree with a VS generator.


Issue 4:

Even if I called "ctest -V --test-dir _build", ctest still cannot pass.
Most of the case is due to file not found. (I didn't fix all the test code yet, so I am not sure whether there is any other problems). I might open a issue in liboqs and make a pr for part of the fix.

Conclusion:
[Not final solution](https://github.com/qnfm/oqs-provider/blob/msvc_ci/.github/workflows/windows.yml)

issue.title: Tests fail: cannot find test program files on Windows in the build tree with a VS generator
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Additional ctest (all of them) failed on windows

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

Open x64 Native Tools Command Prompt for VS 2022
```
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs.git
cd liboqs
mkdir build && cd build
cmake ..
msbuild ALL_BUILD.vcxproj
msbuild tests\run_tests.vcxproj
```

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
All test cases pass

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10 x64 1903
 - OpenSSL version: 3.1.2
 - Compiler version used: MSVC v143/Visual Studio 2022-ver 17.7.4
 - liboqs version: main branch

**Additional context**
VS log for Debug/x64 build

```
......
1>program_name = 'speed_sig'
1>
1>    def path_to_executable(program_name):
1>        path = "."
1>        if sys.platform.startswith("win"):
1>            if 'APPVEYOR_BUILD_FOLDER' not in os.environ: os.environ['APPVEYOR_BUILD_FOLDER'] = "."
1>            path = os.path.join(path, os.environ['APPVEYOR_BUILD_FOLDER'])
1>        path = os.path.join(path, get_current_build_dir_name(), "tests")
1>        for executable in [
1>            os.path.join(path, program_name),
1>            os.path.join(path, program_name + ".EXE"),
1>            os.path.join(path, program_name + ".exe")]:
1>                if os.path.isfile(executable):
1>                    return executable1>>       assert False, "Unable to find executable file {}".format(program_name)
1>E       AssertionError: Unable to find executable file speed_sig
1>
1>tests\helpers.py:150: AssertionError
1>=========================== short test summary info ===========================
1>FAILED tests/test_cmdline.py::test_sig[Dilithium5] - AssertionError: Unable t...
1>FAILED tests/test_alg_info.py::test_alg_info_kem[FrodoKEM-1344-SHAKE] - Asser...
1>FAILED tests/test_cmdline.py::test_kem[Classic-McEliece-348864] - AssertionEr...
1>FAILED tests/test_alg_info.py::test_alg_info_kem[Classic-McEliece-348864] - A...
1>FAILED tests/test_alg_info.py::test_alg_info_sig[Dilithium2] - AssertionError...
......
```

comment.body:
By default, VS generate built test files in liboqs\build\tests\Debug\*(liboqs\build\tests\Release\*). But the helper.path_to_executable() try to find files in liboqs\build\tests\*. 
So the follow code snippet work:
```
    for executable in [
        os.path.join(path, program_name),
        os.path.join(path, program_name + ".EXE"),
        os.path.join(path, program_name + ".exe"),        
        os.path.join(path, "Debug",program_name + ".exe"),
        os.path.join(path, "Release",program_name + ".exe")]:
            if os.path.isfile(executable):
                return executable
```

Should I make a PR for that, or go through the test\*.py to fix all?

issue.title: Bump oqs-sys/liboqs from `b3b0fbb` to `e6c650c`

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: submodules
labels.description: Pull requests that update Submodules code

issue.body:
Bumps [oqs-sys/liboqs](https://github.com/Open-Quantum-Safe/liboqs) from `b3b0fbb` to `e6c650c`.
Commits
  • e6c650c Document Falcon constant time errors (#1552)
  • b8a0bc7 Add Windows ARM64 support (#1545)
  • cc313b2 Add CI for apple mobile platforms (#1546)
  • f761b06 Pull Neon implementation of Falcon from PQClean (#1547)
  • 7ef422a Update Classic McEliece suppression files (#1541)
  • 456015c Bump gitpython from 3.1.34 to 3.1.35 in /scripts/copy_from_upstream (#1551)
  • See full diff in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.title: Expand test coverage to all 100 NIST KAT values
issue.body: Currently our KAT tests only test against the first KAT, but most NIST submissions include (if memory serves) 100 values. We could do all of these.

comment.body: Bumping this discussion to note that I recently encountered a subtle bug when patching HQC that only affected two of the 100 KATs. The PQClean automated tests all pass on the buggy version, since they also check only the first KAT.
